title: How to Block a Number on Android

steps.title: Open your Android's Phone app.
steps.content: Open your Android's Phone app. This phone-shaped app should be on your Android's Home Screen. If you're not on a Samsung, jump ahead to our methods for Pixel or Nexus phones , LG phones , or HTC phones .

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . This three-dot icon is in the top-right corner of the Phone screen. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This option is at the bottom of the drop-down menu. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Block numbers.
steps.content: Tap Block numbers . It's below the "CALL SETTINGS" heading near the middle of the screen. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Enter a number.
steps.content: Enter a number. Tap the text field below the "Add phone number" heading, then type in the number you want to block. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . This button is in the keypad at the bottom of the screen. Doing so will save the number to your Samsung's block list and your phone will not ring when that number tries to call you. [4] X Research source To unblock numbers, return to this page and tap the trashcan icon next to the number you want to unblock. Some Samsung models and only a few carriers support Smart Call, which is a Caller ID feature that lets you block unknown calls that aren't in your Contacts. To enable this, go to ⋮ > Settings and enable the switch next to "Caller ID and spam protection." With this enabled, you'll be able to block calls as they are incoming by tapping the Block button at the bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Open your Android's Phone app.
steps.content: Open your Android's Phone app. The Google Phone app is what most Pixel or Nexus phones use by default. You'll find this phone-shaped app on the Home Screen. [5] X Research source Many stock Androids will work identically..

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . It's in the top-right corner of the Phone screen. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This option is in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap Blocked Numbers.
steps.content: Tap Blocked Numbers . You'll find this near the top of the page. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap ADD A NUMBER.
steps.content: Tap ADD A NUMBER . It's at the top of the page.

steps.title: Enter a number to block.
steps.content: Enter a number to block. Tap the text field, then type in the number you want to block.

steps.title: Tap BLOCK.
steps.content: Tap BLOCK . It's below the text field. Your phone will not ring when a blocked number tries to call you. You can also check the "Report call as spam" box to report the call. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Open your Android's Phone app.
steps.content: Open your Android's Phone app. It's a phone-shaped app on the Home Screen. Although LG no longer makes new phones, this method is useful if you have an older LG phone. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Call logs tab.
steps.content: Tap the Call logs tab. You'll find this either at the top or at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Tap Call settings.
steps.content: Tap Call settings . This option is in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap Call blocking.
steps.content: Tap Call blocking . It's below the "GENERAL" heading.

steps.title: Tap Blocked numbers.
steps.content: Tap Blocked numbers . You'll find this near the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . Doing so will bring up a window with blocking options.

steps.title: Tap New number.
steps.content: Tap New number . This will prompt a text field to appear. You can also tap Contacts to select a number from your contacts, or Call logs to select a recent number. Doing so will immediately add the number to your block list.

steps.title: Enter a number.
steps.content: Enter a number. Tap the text field, then type in the number you want to block.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . It's below the text field. The number will be blocked and your phone will not ring when that number tries to call you.

steps.title: Open your Android's People app.
steps.content: Open your Android's People app. This app resembles a person's silhouette. It's typically found on your Android's Home Screen. Many HTC phones are now sold exclusively in Taiwan, but if you have an HTC phone, this method will be helpful to you.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap Manage contacts.
steps.content: Tap Manage contacts . This option is in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap Blocked contacts.
steps.content: Tap Blocked contacts . You'll find it near the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap Add.
steps.content: Tap Add . This option is near the top of the page.

steps.title: Enter a number.
steps.content: Enter a number. Type in the number that you want to block.

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . Doing so will add the number to your HTC phone's block list and your phone will not ring when that number tries to call you.

steps.title: Open Should I Answer.
steps.content: Open Should I Answer. This app icon resembles an octopus arm holding a phone receiver. If you don't have the Should I Answer app, you can get it for free from the Google Play Store. [9] X Research source Use the search bar at the top of the screen to search for "Should I Answer," then tap the Install button. If you want to try a different third-party app, jump to our section on the Mr. Number app .

steps.title: Follow the on-screen setup instructions.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen setup instructions. Tap Next twice (if prompted), then tap to select the boxes and tap Get Started . You'll only need to tap Next and give permissions to the app the first time that you open it.

steps.title: Choose the level of protection that you want.
steps.content: Choose the level of protection that you want. If you want the app to take over as your default phone app and have the ability to block calls, tap Active Protection . You'll only need to tap Next and give permissions to the app the first time that you open it.

steps.title: Choose your alert type and tap Set.
steps.content: Choose your alert type and tap Set . If you're using at least Android 6 and above, you should use Custom Call Screen and tap Set to continue. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Set the app as your default phone app.
steps.content: Set the app as your default phone app. If you don't do this, then Should I Answer will not be able to block incoming calls that you've set to block. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Start The App.
steps.content: Tap Start The App . It's at the bottom of your screen and will redirect you to the main screen of the app, which is your Recents list.

steps.title: Tap a number that you want to block.
steps.content: Tap a number that you want to block. You can use your Recents list as well as your Contacts.

steps.title: Tap Block.
steps.content: Tap Block . It's near the top of the page, below the displayed number. That number is now blocked and your phone will not ring when it calls you. [12] X Research source If the number you're blocking was someone trying to sell you stuff or warning you about your car's warranty, use the extra action buttons to mark it as "Spam" so the Should I Answer community sees the warning.

steps.title: Open Mr.
steps.content: Open Mr. Number. This app icon features an "M" and "N". If you don't have this app, you can install it from the Google Play Store. While it isn't free and requires a subscription to use, it's highly rated and very popular. [13] X Research source To download from the Google Play Store, you can use the search bar at the top of your screen to search for "Mr. Number" then tap the Install button.

steps.title: Tap Get Started.
steps.content: Tap Get Started . It's the blue button in the center of the page. Make sure the checkbox next to "I've read and agree to Mr. Number's Terms of Service and Data policy" is checked.

steps.title: Subscribe to Mr.
steps.content: Subscribe to Mr. Number. Mr. Number requires a subscription fee that's either monthly or yearly. You'll be offered a free 3-day trial when you subscribe to the monthly plan, so tap that option. You may need to enter your password, FaceID, or TouchID/fingerprint to purchase a subscription.

steps.title: Tap Allow All.
steps.content: Tap Allow All . In order for Mr. Number to work properly, you'll need to allow the app to make and manage calls as well as give it call log access. Tap Continue to proceed after you've given the app access.

steps.title: Set more Mr.
steps.content: Set more Mr. Number settings. You'll see a list of recommended settings, like allowing the app to display over other apps, along with reasoning for that permission (for example, the app recommends Mr. Number has permission to be the default spam app, which is needed to allow Mr. Number to accurately identify and block unwanted calls). Tap Allow on each tile, then tap Continue at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the Block List tab.
steps.content: Tap the Block List tab. This is the second tab at the bottom of the screen. It has an icon that resembles a circle with a line through it and will allow you to block numbers and set exceptions. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Tap .
steps.content: Tap . It's the icon that resembles a circle with a plus sign (+). This lets you add a new blocked number.

steps.title: Tap a method to block a number.
steps.content: Tap a method to block a number. Methods include the following: Choose from contacts Enter a number All numbers beginning with... Recent calls.

steps.title: Enter or select a number to block.
steps.content: Enter or select a number to block. If you are selecting a number from your contacts, or recent calls, tap the number you want to block. If you want to enter a number, enter the number.

steps.title: Tap Block.
steps.content: Tap Block . This blocks the number you selected and you will not be notified if that number tries to contact you. [15] X Research source There are more settings available with Mr. Number, but this is just how you can block a number.
